content.json: >**NOTE:** This workbook depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**Corelight**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-Corelight-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

parameters.name: Sensor
parameters.label: Corelight Sensor
parameters.query:
corelight_conn
| distinct sensor_name
| sort by sensor_name

content.title: Sensor Events Timechart

content.query:
union Corelight_v2_*_CL
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name_s in ({Sensor}))
| where TimeGenerated {GlobalTimeRestriction}
| summarize Count=count() by _path_s | sort by Count desc
content.title: Sensor Events Count

content.query:
let QueryResults = ((corelight_notice
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name in ({Sensor}))
//| where note != "LongConnection::found" and note != "SSL::Invalid_Server_Cert"
//| project-rename Alert = note 
| union corelight_suricata_corelight)
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name in ({Sensor}))
//| where alert_category != "Not Suspicious Traffic" and alert_category != "Attempted Information Leak" and alert_category != "Potentially Bad Traffic"
//| where _path_s == "notice"
//| project-rename Alert = alert_category
| extend
    Category = coalesce(note, alert_category),
    Alert = coalesce(msg, alert_signature),
    Severity=coalesce(severity_level, alert_severity, 7.),
    Type = _path
| extend PartitionKey = case(_path == "suricata_corelight", Alert, Category)
| where (isnotempty(uid) or isnotempty(community_id))
| partition hint.strategy=native by PartitionKey
    (
    top 10 by TimeGenerated
    )
| order by Severity asc, TimeGenerated
// hack to hide empty columns
| evaluate narrow()
| where isnotempty(Value) and Value != "##(null)" or Column == "_system_name_s"
| evaluate pivot(Column, any(Value), Row)
);
let QueryCount=QueryResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(TimeGenerated: string , Type: string , Category: string, Alert: string, Severity: string, uid: string, id_orig_h: string, id_resp_h: string, id_resp_p: string )[];
union isfuzzy=true
(QueryResults| where toscalar(QueryCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(QueryCount) == 0)
| project-reorder
    TimeGenerated,
    Type,
    Category,
    Alert,
    Severity,
    uid,
    id_orig_h,
    id_resp_h,
    id_resp_p
content.title: Recent Events Summary (10 most recent per message type)

content.query:
union Corelight_v2_*_CL
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name_s in ({Sensor}))
| where (isnotempty("{Selected_uid}") and (uid_s == "{Selected_uid}" or conn_uids_s contains_cs "{Selected_uid}"))
| top 300 by TimeGenerated
// hack to hide empty columns
| evaluate narrow()
| where isnotempty(Value) and Value != "##(null)" or Column == "_system_name_s"
| evaluate pivot(Column, any(Value), Row)
| project-reorder TimeGenerated, _path_s, id_orig_h_s, id_resp_h_s, id_resp_p_d, _system_name_s
| project-away Row
content.title: Related paths (select in Events Summary)

content.query:
corelight_suricata_corelight
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize alert_count=count() by source_ip=id_orig_h, alert_signature, severity=alert_severity
| top 10 by alert_count
content.title: Suricata Top Alerts by Source

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where local_resp == true and (proto == "tcp" or (proto == "udp" and orig_bytes > 0 and resp_bytes > 0))
| where conn_state != "S0"
| summarize count() by id_resp_h, id_resp_p, service
| summarize Count=count() by service
| top 20 by Count
content.title: Local Hosts Seen Offering Services

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where proto=="tcp" or (proto=="udp" and orig_pkts>0 and resp_pkts>0)
| where conn_state != "S0"
| where local_resp==true
| summarize Count=count() by portproto=strcat(tostring(toint(id_resp_p)), "/", proto)
| top 15 by Count
content.title: Top Responder Ports

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where local_orig == false and local_resp == true
| where proto=="tcp" or (proto=="udp" and orig_pkts>0 and resp_pkts>0)
| where conn_state!="S0"
| summarize number_of_conns=count(), orig_bytes_sum=sum(orig_bytes) by id_orig_h, service
| extend orig_data = format_bytes(orig_bytes_sum, 2)
| order by orig_bytes_sum desc
| top 20 by orig_bytes_sum desc
| project-away orig_bytes_sum
content.title: Top Inbound Data Flows by Originator

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where proto == "tcp" or (proto == "udp" and orig_pkts>0 and resp_pkts>0)
| where local_orig==true and local_resp==false
| where conn_state != "S0"
| summarize number_of_conns=count(), orig_bytes_sum=sum(orig_bytes) by id_orig_h, service
| extend orig_data = format_bytes(orig_bytes_sum, 2)
| order by orig_bytes_sum desc
| project-away orig_bytes_sum
content.title: Top Outbound Data Flows by Originator

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where conn_state=="S0"
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h, id_resp_p, service
| order by Count desc
content.title: Hosts Generating S0 (possible scan) Traffic

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where proto=="tcp" or (proto=="udp" and orig_pkts>0 and resp_pkts>0)
| where conn_state != "S0"
| summarize number_of_conns=count(), orig_bytes_sum=sum(orig_bytes), resp_bytes_sum=sum(resp_bytes) by id_orig_h, id_resp_h, id_resp_p, proto
| extend total_bytes_sum = orig_bytes_sum + resp_bytes_sum
| extend total_data = format_bytes(total_bytes_sum, 2)
| top 20 by total_bytes_sum desc
content.title: Largest transfers between host/port pairs

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where local_resp == true and conn_state == "S0"
| summarize Count=count() by id_resp_h, id_resp_p, service
| top 30 by Count
content.title: Possible Down Services

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize Count=count() by history
| top 20 by Count
content.title: Monitor Health Asymmetry (All UPPER or lower is bad)

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where local_orig == false and local_resp == false
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h, id_resp_h, id_resp_p, service
| top 20 by Count
content.title: Remote to Remote Connections

content.query:
corelight_notice
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or _system_name in ({Sensor}))
| where note == "LongConnection::found"
| summarize Count=count(1), arg_max(TimeGenerated, id_orig_h, id_resp_h, id_resp_p, sub, msg) by uid
| extend seconds=sub
| top 20 by seconds desc
content.title: Longest Lived Connections, (May have already closed)
Top Services
Top Responder Ports
Top Outbound Data Flows by Originator Bytes

items.name: Top Outbound Data Flows by Originator Bytes

content.title: Top Inbound Data Flows by Originator Bytes

items.name: Top Inbound Data Flows by Originator Bytes - Copy

content.title: Top Originators (sources) by # of connections
Top Responders (destinations) by # of connections

items.name: Top Responders (destinations) by # of connections - Copy

content.title: Open/Active Long Lived Connections (requires Long Connections Pkg)

items.name: Open/Active Long Lived Connections (requires Long Connections Pkg)

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
//| where is_broadcast_b!=true
| summarize Count=count() by qtype_name
| top 10 by Count
content.title: Top Query Types

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where (rcode_name=="NXDOMAIN" or rcode==3) and qtype_name != "PTR"
| summarize Count=count() by qtype_name
| top 20 by Count
content.title: No response DNS query by type

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 53 and (rcode_name == "NXDOMAIN" or rcode == 3) and qtype_name != "PTR"
| summarize Count=count() by query
| top 100 by Count
content.title: Top Queries by Count to Non-Existent Domains

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 53
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h
| top 20 by Count
content.title: Top Originators by Count

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 53 and qtype_name != "ptr"
| summarize Count=count() by query
| top 100 by Count
content.title: Top Queries by Count

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p==53 and qtype_name=="PTR" and (rcode_name=="NOERROR" or rcode==0)
| summarize Count=count() by query
| top 100 by Count
content.title: Top Successful Reverse Queries by Count

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 53 and (rcode_name == "NXDOMAIN" or rcode == 3) and qtype_name != "PTR"
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h
| top 20 by Count
content.title: Top Host querying Non-Existent Domains

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 53 and qtype_name == "PTR" and (rcode_name == "NXDOMAIN" or rcode == 3)
| summarize Count=count() by query
| top 100 by Count
content.title: Top Reverse Queries by Count to Non-Existent Domains

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend query_length = string_size(query)
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h, query_length, query
| order by query_length desc
content.title: DNS by Query Length
Top 20 Mime Types by File Count

items.name: Top 20 Mime Types by File Count

content.title: Top File Protocols by File Count

items.name: Top File Protocols by File Count

content.query:
corelight_files
//| where EventType startswith "files"
| where isnotempty(mime_type)
| where mime_type != "application/pkix-cert"
| extend NetworkDirection = case(local_orig == "true", "outbound", local_orig == "false", "inbound", "" )
|make-series ["Files Sent"]=countif(NetworkDirection=="outbound"), ["Files Received"]=countif(NetworkDirection=="inbound") on TimeGenerated from {GlobalTimeRestriction:start} to {GlobalTimeRestriction:end} step {GlobalTimeRestriction:grain} by path | project ["Files Sent"], ["Files Received"], TimeGenerated
content.title: File Flow - # of Files
File Flow - Bytes

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize distinct_referrers=count_distinct(referrer)
content.title: Distinct Referrers

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize distinct_user_agents=count_distinct(user_agent)
content.title: Distinct User Agents

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize count_distinct(host)
content.title: Distinct Hosts

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize distinct_connections=count_distinct(uid)
content.title: Distinct Connections

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize avg = format_bytes(avg(response_body_len), 2)
content.title: Average Body Length

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| extend ua_length = strlen(user_agent)
| summarize avg_ua_length = round(avg(ua_length))
content.title: Average User Agent Length

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize Count=count() by host
| top 10 by Count
content.title: Top Host Headers by Count

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize Count=count() by status_msg
| top 10 by Count
content.title: HTTP Status Code Breakdown

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize Count=count() by id_orig_h
| top 10 by Count
content.title: Top Originators

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize Count=count() by user_agent
| top 10 by Count asc
content.title: Rare User Agents

content.query:
corelight_http
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where host != "control"
| summarize Count=count() by host, status_code
| top 10 by Count asc
content.title: Rare Host Headers
Top Software
Top Software Versions

content.query:
corelight_software
//| where EventType startswith "software"
| where isnotempty(software_type)
| summarize Count=count() by software_type | sort by Count
content.title: Top Software Types

content.json: ## Security Posture

### Encrypted Traffic Hygiene
---

content.title: Self Signed Certs
Certs w/ Low Keys

content.query:
corelight_x509
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where days_to_expiry > 0 and days_to_expiry <= 15
| summarize ["Distinct Certs"] = dcount(ssl_hash)
content.title: Expiring Certs.
Encrypted Traffic Over Time

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend version_status=case(version=="TLSv13", "Most Secure", 
                            version=="TLSv12", "Secure", 
                            version=="DTLSv12", "Secure", 
                            version=="unknown-64282", "Unknown", 
                            "Old Version")
| summarize Count= count() by version_status
| sort by Count desc
content.title: TLS Versions

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend src_internal=iff(isnull(is_src_internal_ip) or is_src_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Internal"), dest_internal=iff(isnull(is_dest_internal_ip) or is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Internal")
| where src_internal=="Internal" 
| extend version_status=case(version=="TLSv13", "Most Secure", 
                            version=="TLSv12", "Secure", 
                            version=="DTLSv12", "Secure", 
                            version=="unknown-64282", "Unknown", 
                            "Old Version")
| summarize Count= count() by version_status
| sort by Count desc
content.title: Internal TLS Version Profile

content.json:
### Unencrypted Traffic Hygiene - Indicators
---

content.title: Unencrypted Connections

content.json: #### Click on the count in the above panel **Unencrypted Connections** to view more information.

content.query:
union isfuzzy=true
corelight_http,
corelight_conn,
corelight_dns,
corelight_ssl,
corelight_files
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 23
| summarize Count = count()
content.title: Telnet Sessions

content.json: #### Click on the count in the above panel **Telnet Sessions** to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_ftp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize Count = count()
content.title: FTP Sessions

content.json: #### Click on the count in the above panel **FTP Sessions** to view more information.

content.query:
let interval_in_hrs= datetime_diff('hour', {GlobalTimeRestriction:end}, {GlobalTimeRestriction:start});
let interval_in_days= datetime_diff('day', {GlobalTimeRestriction:end}, {GlobalTimeRestriction:start});
let bin_duration=case(interval_in_hrs<=24, 1h, interval_in_days<=30, 1d, interval_in_days>=31 and interval_in_days<=90, 7d, 31d);
union isfuzzy=true
corelight_http,
corelight_conn,
corelight_dns,
corelight_ssl,
corelight_files
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where isnotempty(service) and service !in ('ssl', 'tls', 'dns', "ssl,http", "http,ssl")
| make-series ["Unencrypted Traffic Volume"]=count() default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {GlobalTimeRestriction:start} to {GlobalTimeRestriction:end} step bin_duration by service
content.title: Top Unencrypted Protocols Used

content.json: #### Click on the datapoints in the above panel **Top Unencrypted Protocols Used** to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_etc_viz
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where  viz_stat in ("C", "Cc", "C!", "cc") 
| summarize Count = count() by server_a, server_p
content.title: Details of Unencrypted Connections

content.query:
union corelight_http,
corelight_conn,
corelight_dns,
corelight_ssl,
corelight_files
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where id_resp_p == 23
content.title: Details of Telnet Sessions

content.query:
corelight_ftp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
content.title: Details of FTP Sessions

content.query:
union isfuzzy=true
corelight_http,
corelight_conn,
corelight_dns,
corelight_ssl,
corelight_files
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where service == '{service}'
content.title: Details of Top Unencrypted Protocols Used

content.json:
### DNS Hygiene
---

content.title: Failed DNS Queries
Unusual Qtypes
NXDOMAIN Responses

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where isnotempty(dest_ip) and dest_port in (53, 5353) and is_dest_internal_ip=="true"
| summarize NumberOfInternalDnsServers = dcount(dest_ip)
content.title: Internal DNS Servers

content.json: #### Click on the count in the above panel **Unusual Qtypes** to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where qtype_name in ("AXFR", "IXFR", "ANY", "TXT")
| summarize unique_sessions=dcount(uid), query_list = strcat_array(make_list(query), ", "), qtype_names = strcat_array(make_list(qtype_name), ", ") by id_orig_h, id_resp_h
content.title: Details of Unusual Qtypes

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend iplocation=geo_info_from_ip_address(dest_ip)
| extend latitude=iplocation.latitude, longitude=iplocation.longitude
| extend Country = coalesce(iplocation.country, "No Country")
| summarize Count = count() by tostring(latitude), tostring(longitude), Country
| extend coordinates= iff(Country!="No Country", strcat("Country: ",Country, "\nLatitude: ", latitude, "\nLongitude:", longitude), Country)
content.title: Geolocation of DNS Responses

content.json:
### Remote Management Hygiene
---

content.query:
let TopVPN=corelight_vpn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend iplocation=geo_info_from_ip_address(dest_ip)
| extend country=iplocation.country
| extend Country=coalesce(country, "No Country")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by dest_ip, tostring(Country)
| summarize Count=count() by Country;
let totalcount=(
TopVPN
| summarize TotalCount = sum(Count));
TopVPN
| extend Percentage=(Count * 100.0)/toscalar(totalcount)
| sort by Percentage desc
content.title: Top VPN destinations by Country
Outbound VPN Connections

content.json: #### Metrics shows the count and percentage for the country with maximum value as default. To view the count or percentage for a particular country hover over the bar in Top VPN destinations by Country Panel.

items.name: Tooltip for Top VPN destinations by Country Panel

content.title: RDP Authentication Attempts

content.json: #### Click on the datapoints in the above panel **RDP Authentication Attempts** to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_rdp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend auth_result = iff(auth_success=="true","Success","Failure") 
| where auth_result == '{auth}'
content.title: Details of RDP Authentication Attempts

content.json:
## Secure Channel Insights
#### Deep dive from Security Posture Encrypted, non-encrypted SSL, SSH, TLS and x509 facts.

### Encrypted Traffic Notables
----

content.query:
corelight_x509
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend key_length=certificate_key_length, match_fingerprint=fingerprint
| where toint(key_length) < 2048
| project match_fingerprint, key_length, TimeGenerated
| join kind=inner (
    corelight_ssl
    | where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
    | mv-expand todynamic(cert_chain_fps)
    | extend match_fingerprint=cert_chain_fps
    | project tostring(match_fingerprint), uid, src_ip, dest_ip, id_resp_p, is_dest_internal_ip, server_name, TimeGenerated)
 on match_fingerprint
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by match_fingerprint
| extend Host_Type=iff(is_dest_internal_ip=="true", "Internal", "External"), Resp_port=id_resp_p
| where Host_Type == "Internal"
| summarize Count= count() by server_name, dest_ip, Resp_port, key_length, Host_Type
| summarize Sum = count()

content.json: #### SSL/TLS sessions utilizing weak keys are vulnerable to cryptographic attacks. This traffic may indicate the presence of old and/or unpatched resources on the network. It could also be the result of a successful downgrade attack.

content.query:
let CertResults = corelight_x509
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend key_length=certificate_key_length
| extend match_fingerprint=fingerprint
| where toint(key_length) < 2048
| project match_fingerprint, key_length, TimeGenerated
| join kind=inner ( 
    corelight_ssl
    | where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
    | mv-expand todynamic(cert_chain_fps)
    | extend match_fingerprint=cert_chain_fps
    | project tostring(match_fingerprint), uid, src_ip, dest_ip, id_resp_p, is_dest_internal_ip, server_name, TimeGenerated)
 on match_fingerprint
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by match_fingerprint
| extend ["Host Type"]=iff(is_dest_internal_ip=="true", "Internal", "External"), Resp_Port=id_resp_p, Dest_Host=dest_ip, ["Key Length"]=key_length, ["Server Name"]=server_name
| where ["Host Type"] == "Internal"
| summarize Count= count() by ["Server Name"], Dest_Host, Resp_Port, ["Key Length"], ["Host Type"]
| sort by ["Server Name"] desc;
let CertCount = CertResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(["Server Name"]: string, Dest_Host: string, Resp_Port: string, ["Key Length"]: string, ["Host Type"]: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(CertResults| where toscalar(CertCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(CertCount) == 0)
| extend Resp_Port = coalesce(tostring(toint(Resp_Port_real)), Resp_Port_string)
| extend ["Key Length"] = coalesce(tostring(toint(['Key Length_real'])), ['Key Length_string'])
| project-away Resp_Port_*, ["Key Length_*"]
| project-reorder ["Server Name"], Dest_Host, Resp_Port, ["Key Length"], ["Host Type"], Count
content.title: Network Evidence for Weak Key Length Certs

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where cipher matches regex ("RC4|DES|3DES|MD5|NULL|EXPORT")
| extend Host_Type=iff(is_src_internal_ip=="true", "Internal", "External")
| extend Direction=iff(is_src_internal_ip=="true" and is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "Outbound", "Inbound")
| summarize Unique_Conns=dcount(uid), Count=count() by cipher
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### SSL/TLS sessions utilizing weak cipher suites (eg. RC4) are easily decrypted. This traffic may indicate the presence of old and/or unpatched resources on the network. It could also be the result of a successful downgrade attack.

content.query:
let QueryResults = corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where cipher matches regex ("RC4|DES|3DES|MD5|NULL|EXPORT")
| extend Host_Type=iff(is_src_internal_ip=="true", "Internal", "External")
| extend Direction=iff(is_src_internal_ip=="true" and is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "Outbound", "Inbound")
| summarize dest_ip = make_list(dest_ip)[-1], Unique_Conns=dcount(uid), Host_Type=strcat_array(make_set(Host_Type), ","), Direction=strcat_array(make_set(Direction), ","), Count=count() by cipher
| project-rename Cipher=cipher
| sort by Unique_Conns desc, Count desc;
let QueryCount = QueryResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(Cipher: string, dest_ip: dynamic, Unique_Conns: string, Host_Type: string, Direction: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(QueryResults| where toscalar(QueryCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(QueryCount) == 0)
| extend Unique_Conns = coalesce(tostring(tolong(Unique_Conns_long)), Unique_Conns_string)
| project-away Unique_Conns_*
content.title: Less Secure Ciphers seen in the period
Connections using Less Secure TLS Versions (< TLS1.2)

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where isnotempty(src_ip) and isnotempty(version)
| extend ip_class = iff(is_dest_internal_ip == "true", "Internal", "External")
| extend src_int = iff(isnull(is_src_internal_ip) or is_src_internal_ip=="false", "f", "t"), 
    dst_int = iff(isnull(is_dest_internal_ip) or is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "f", "t") 
| extend 
    connection_type=case(
    src_int=="t" and dst_int=="f", "Outbound",
    src_int=="f" and dst_int=="t", "Inbound",
    src_int=="t" and dst_int=="t", "Internal",
    "EEther"
    ),
    version_status=case(
    version=="TLSv13", "Most Secure (v1.3)",
    version=="TLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)",
    version=="DTLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)", 
    version=="unknown-64282", "Unknown",
    "Old Version < (v1.2)") 
| extend Classification=version_status, ["Traffic Direction"]=connection_type, Version=version
| where ('*' == ('{TrafficDirection}') or ["Traffic Direction"] == ('{TrafficDirection}'))
| where Classification !contains "Secure"
| summarize Counter=dcount(uid) by tostring(Version), Classification, "Traffic Direction"
| summarize Sum=sum(Counter)

content.json: #### Connections employing TLS versions older than 1.2 are recognized as less secure, presenting a higher risk of being compromised. These outdated protocols may indicate legacy systems with configurations that are not aligned with modern security standards.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where isnotempty(src_ip) and isnotempty(version)
| extend ip_class = iff(is_dest_internal_ip == "true", "Internal", "External")
| extend src_int = iff(isnull(is_src_internal_ip) or is_src_internal_ip=="false", "f", "t"), 
    dst_int = iff(isnull(is_dest_internal_ip) or is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "f", "t") 
| extend 
    connection_type=case(
    src_int=="t" and dst_int=="f", "Outbound",
    src_int=="f" and dst_int=="t", "Inbound",
    src_int=="t" and dst_int=="t", "Internal",
    "EEther"
    ),
    version_status=case(
    version=="TLSv13", "Most Secure (v1.3)",
    version=="TLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)",
    version=="DTLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)", 
    version=="unknown-64282", "Unknown",
    "Old Version < (v1.2)") 
| extend Classification=version_status, ["Traffic Direction"]=connection_type, Version=version
| where ('*' == ('{TrafficDirection}') or ["Traffic Direction"] == ('{TrafficDirection}'))
| summarize Counter=dcount(uid), ["Responder Location"] = strcat_array(make_set(ip_class), ",") by tostring(Version), Classification, ["Traffic Direction"]
| project-reorder Version, ["Traffic Direction"], Counter, ["Responder Location"], Classification
| sort by Counter desc;
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(Version: string, Counter: long)
["No Results Found", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: Network Evidence for All TLS versions seen (Classification based on Industry best practices)

items.name: group - 2-Connections using Less Secure TLS Versions (< TLS1.2)

content.query:
corelight_ssh 
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences), todynamic(Descriptions)
| where Inferences in ("KS", "AUTO") 
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| extend src_ip = id_orig_h, dest_ip = id_resp_h, Inference=Inferences, Description=Descriptions
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip, tostring(Inference), tostring(Description) 
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### Highlight interactive sessions (KS) and automated interactions (AUTO) to understand the nature of SSH traffic — manual vs. automated.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssh 
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences), todynamic(Descriptions)
| where Inferences in ("KS", "AUTO") 
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| extend src_ip = id_orig_h, dest_ip = id_resp_h, Inference=Inferences, Description=Descriptions
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip, tostring(Inference), tostring(Description);
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(uid: string, src_ip: string, dest_ip: string, Inference: string, Description: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: Network Evidence for Interactive Sessions and Keystrokes - SSH Inferences

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where validation_status=="self signed certificate" and is_dest_internal_ip=="true" and isnotempty(dest_ip)
| extend Source_Host_Type = case(is_src_internal_ip=="true", "Internal",is_src_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Undefined") , 
Destination_Host_Type = case(is_dest_internal_ip=="true", "Internal",is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Undefined")
| extend Traffic_Direction = case(Source_Host_Type=="Internal" and Destination_Host_Type=="External", "Outbound",Source_Host_Type=="External" and Destination_Host_Type=="Internal", "Inbound",Source_Host_Type=="Internal" and Destination_Host_Type=="Internal", "East-West",Source_Host_Type=="External" and Destination_Host_Type=="External", "Ether","Undefined") 
| summarize count() by ssl_subject_common_name, dest_ip 
| count

content.json: #### This dashboard panel identifies self-signed certificates in use within internal networks, highlighting a key security concern due to their lack of third-party validation. Addressing this issue by transitioning to certificates from trusted authorities enhances network security and trustworthiness.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where validation_status=="self signed certificate" and is_dest_internal_ip=="true" and isnotempty(dest_ip)
| extend Source_Host_Type = case(is_src_internal_ip=="true", "Internal",is_src_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Undefined") , 
Destination_Host_Type = case(is_dest_internal_ip=="true", "Internal",is_dest_internal_ip=="false", "External", "Undefined")
| extend Traffic_Direction = case(Source_Host_Type=="Internal" and Destination_Host_Type=="External", "Outbound",Source_Host_Type=="External" and Destination_Host_Type=="Internal", "Inbound",Source_Host_Type=="Internal" and Destination_Host_Type=="Internal", "East-West",Source_Host_Type=="External" and Destination_Host_Type=="External", "Ether","Undefined") 
| summarize Destination_Host_Type=strcat_array(make_set(Destination_Host_Type), ","), Status=strcat_array(make_set(validation_status), ","), Traffic_Direction=strcat_array(make_set(Traffic_Direction), ",") 
 by ssl_subject_common_name, dest_ip 
| project Subject=ssl_subject_common_name, Destination=dest_ip, Status, Destination_Host_Type, Traffic_Direction;
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(Subject: string)
["No Results Found"];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: Network Evidence for Self Signed Internal Certificates

content.query:
corelight_ssh
| where ('*' == ('*') or sensor_name == ('*'))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences), todynamic(Descriptions)
| where Inferences in ("SFD", "LFD", "SFU", "LFU")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| project-rename
    Inference = Inferences,
    Description = Descriptions
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip,tostring(Inference), tostring(Description)
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### This use case tracks SSH file transfer activity (inferences SFD, LFD, SFU, LFU). It uncovers potential data exfiltration by attackers or the introduction of malicious files. Focus on file names, sizes, unusual source IPs, and sensitive destination systems.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssh
| where ('*' == ('*') or sensor_name == ('*'))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences), todynamic(Descriptions)
| where Inferences in ("SFD", "LFD", "SFU", "LFU")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| project-rename
    Inference = Inferences,
    Description = Descriptions
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip,tostring(Inference), tostring(Description);
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(uid: string, src_ip: string, dest_ip: string, Inference: string, Description: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: Possible File Transfer

content.query:
corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where is_dest_internal_ip=="true"
| mv-expand todynamic(fingerprint)
| extend fingerprint=tostring(fingerprint)
| join kind=inner  
    (corelight_x509
    | where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
    | where days_to_expiry > 0 and days_to_expiry < 30)
    on fingerprint
| summarize count() by ssl_subject, dest_ip
| count

content.json: #### A SSL certificate that is about to expire (default window is 30 days) was observed. Expiration of an SSL certificate may result in unexpected behaviour such as refused network connections or unencrypted network traffic.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssl
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where is_dest_internal_ip=="true"
| mv-expand todynamic(fingerprint)
| extend fingerprint=tostring(fingerprint)
| join kind=inner  
    (corelight_x509
    | where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
    | where days_to_expiry > 0 and days_to_expiry < 30)
    on fingerprint
| summarize Port = strcat_array(make_list(toint(dest_port)), ","), ["Not Valid After"] = strcat_array(make_list(not_valid_after), ","), ["Days to Expire"] =  strcat_array(make_list(days_to_expiry), ",") by ssl_subject, dest_ip
| project-rename Subject = ssl_subject, Host = dest_ip
| sort by tostring(["Days to Expire"]) desc; 
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(Subject: string)
["No Results Found"];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: Network Evidence for Self Signed Internal Certificates

content.query:
corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences)
| where Inferences in ("SC", "SP", "SV", "SA", "AFR", "BAN") 
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip, tostring(Inferences)  
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### Monitors for signs of scanning (SC, SP, SV, SA), banner messages (BAN), and agent forwarding (AFR) for compliance and security risk identification.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences)
| where Inferences in ("SC", "SP", "SV", "SA", "AFR", "BAN") 
| summarize Count = count() by uid, src_ip, dest_ip, tostring(Inferences)
| project-reorder uid, src_ip, dest_ip, Count, Inferences;
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(uid: string)
["No Results"];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: SSH Inferences for Potential Security Risks

content.query:
corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences)
| where Inferences in ("PKA", "AUTO", "KS", "CTS")
| summarize
    src_ip = strcat_array(make_list(id_orig_h), ","),
    dest_ip = strcat_array(make_list(id_resp_h), ","),
    Inferences = strcat_array(make_list(Inferences), ","),
    Count = count()
    by uid
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### Tracks automated SSH sessions to enhance security and operational efficiency, highlighting potential risks and compliance issues. It identifies anomalies and unauthorized activities, ensuring that automation tools are used securely and efficiently. This tool is crucial for SOC analysts to monitor for security breaches and optimize system management.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))

| where Inferences in ("PKA", "AUTO", "KS", "CTS")
| summarize
    src_ip = strcat_array(make_list(id_orig_h), ","),
    dest_ip = strcat_array(make_list(id_resp_h), ","),
    Inferences = strcat_array(make_list(Inferences), ","),
    Count = count()
    by uid;
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(uid: string, src_ip: string, dest_ip: string, Inferences: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)

content.query:
corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences)
| where Inferences in ("ABP", "RSP", "RSI", "RSIA", "RSL", "RSK")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| summarize Count = count() by uid, id_orig_h, id_resp_h, tostring(Inferences)
| summarize TotalCount = count()

content.json: #### Helps to identify potential advanced threat indicators such as Client Authentication Bypass (ABP) and Reverse SSH tunneling activities (RSP, RSI, RSIA, RSL, RSK) for in-depth investigation.

content.query:
let SSHResults = corelight_ssh
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| mv-expand todynamic(Inferences)
| where Inferences in ("ABP", "RSP", "RSI", "RSIA", "RSL", "RSK")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| summarize Count = count() by uid, id_orig_h, id_resp_h, tostring(Inferences)
| project-rename Inference = Inferences, src_ip = id_orig_h , dest_ip = id_resp_h;
let SSHCount = SSHResults
| summarize count()
| project count_;
let NoResults = datatable(uid: string, src_ip: string, dest_ip: string, Inference: string, Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0];
union isfuzzy=true
(SSHResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) != 0),
(NoResults| where toscalar(SSHCount) == 0)
content.title: SSH Advanced Threats Inferences

content.json:
## Name Resolution Insights
##### Insights on Name Resolution (DNS)

### DNS Hygiene
----

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize count() by dest_ip
| count

content.json: #### DNS servers actively responding in the network are key to secure operations, translating domain names to IP addresses and directing traffic. It also logs the number of queries and unique clients interacting with the DNS servers, offering insights into possible rogue DNS servers and detecting patterns that may suggest data exfiltration attempts.

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| extend IPInfo = geo_info_from_ip_address(dest_ip)
| summarize
    ["# of Queries"] = count(),
    ["# of Unique Clients"] = dcount(src_ip),
    Country = any(IPInfo.country),
    any(is_dest_internal_ip)
    by dest_ip
| extend
    Internal = iff(
                   any_is_dest_internal_ip == "true",
                   "Yes",
                   "No"
               ),
    Country = iff(isempty(Country), "Unknown", Country)
| project
    Destination = dest_ip,
    ['# of Queries'],
    ['# of Unique Clients'],
    Country,
    Internal
| sort by ['# of Queries'], ['# of Unique Clients'] desc
content.title: DNS Servers actively responding to queries

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where qtype_name in ("AXFR", "IXFR", "ANY", "TXT")
| summarize count() by qtype_name, dest_ip
| summarize Count = sum(count_)

content.json: #### Unusual DNS query types can indicate misconfigurations, experimental features, or potential security threats like data exfiltration or tunneling. Analysts should scrutinize such queries for anomalies and address identified risks to safeguard network security.

content.title: Unusual Query Types found

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where tolower(rcode_name) in ("nxdomain", "noerror")
| extend query_rejected = iff(rejected == true, "Yes", "No")
| summarize count() by src_ip, dest_ip, query, query_rejected
| summarize sum(count_)

content.json: #### High rates of DNS NXDOMAIN responses might suggest misconfigured domains, typographical errors in network requests, or malicious activities such as DNS reconnaissance. Close examination is advised to correct configurations or identify security incidents. Review DNS logs for patterns, validate domain configurations, and check endpoint security for signs of malware.

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where tolower(rcode_name) in ("nxdomain", "noerror")
| extend query_rejected = iff(rejected == true, "Yes", "No")
| summarize count() by src_ip, dest_ip, query, query_rejected
| project Source = src_ip, Responder = dest_ip, Query = query, Rejected = query_rejected, Count = count_
| sort by Count desc
content.title: Network Evidence for NXDOMAIN Responses

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize avg_rtt = avg(todouble(rtt)) by query, dest_ip
| where avg_rtt > 0.015
| extend avg_rtt = round(avg_rtt*1000, 2)
| count

content.json: #### Long DNS query response times may indicate network congestion, server performance issues, or potential security threats. Timely analysis is crucial for maintaining optimal network performance and security. Investigate extended response times by examining server configurations, network traffic, and potential external attacks.

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| summarize avg_rtt = avg(todouble(rtt)) by query, dest_ip
| where avg_rtt > 0.015
| extend avg_rtt = round(avg_rtt*1000, 2)
| project Query = query, Responder = dest_ip, ["Avg. Response Time (ms)"] = avg_rtt
content.title: Monitoring DNS Query Types by AVG time

content.query:
corelight_dns
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where tolower(rcode_name) in ("servfail", "refused", "formerr", "notimp", "notauth")
| summarize count() by rcode_name
| count

content.json: #### Failed DNS queries may point to misconfigurations, outdated systems, or security threats such as network infiltration or DNS poisoning. Analysts should investigate the sources and patterns of these failures to identify and remediate underlying causes, thereby ensuring network integrity and security.

content.title: Network Evidence for Failed DNS Queries

content.query:
corelight_conn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where service == "dns"
| summarize TotalTraffic = sum(todouble(orig_bytes))

content.json: #### Monitor total DNS-related network traffic in MB/GB. Sudden spikes or unusual patterns could signal configuration errors, compromised devices making excessive queries, or potential data exfiltration attempts.

content.title: Monitoring Query Types by AVG time

content.json: ## Remote Activity Insights

### Remote Access Hygiene
---
Total count of RDP success and failed actions within the specified time.

content.query:
corelight_rdp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where action != "unknown"
| summarize count() by action
| summarize Total = sum(count_)

content.json: #### Monitoring RDP authentications is crucial for identifying unauthorized access and distinguishing between successful and failed login attempts. Security teams should analyze trends and cross-reference user activity for rapid response and mitigation.
#### Click on the Count in above tile to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_rdp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where action != "unknown"
content.title: Details of RDP Authentication Attempts
Failed vs Successful Authentications

content.json: #### Click on the datapoints in panel Failed vs Successful Authentications above to view more information.

content.query:
corelight_rdp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where action == "{Action}"
content.title: Details of Failed vs Successful Authentications

content.json: Total count of users with login failures within the specified time.

content.query:
corelight_rdp
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where action == "failure" or auth_success == "false"
| where isnotempty(cookie)
| extend User = cookie
| summarize dcount(User)

content.json: #### Monitoring failed RDP logins is essential for detecting unauthorized access attempts. Security teams should analyze patterns of failed entries against user and IP data to identify potential breaches. This focus helps in quickly addressing vulnerabilities in RDP security. Effective monitoring of these incidents is crucial for maintaining system integrity.

### VPN Insights
---

Total count of VPN connections that have the following inferences NSP - Non-Standard Port RW - Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) COM - Commercial VPN service occurring at the same time which is deemed suspicious.

content.query:
corelight_vpn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where Inferences has_all ("COM", "RW", "NSP")
| summarize count() by src_ip, dest_ip, tostring(Inferences), vpn_type
| count

content.json: #### The combination of the "COM", "RW", and "NSP" inferences in a single VPN connection raises questions: Policy Violation: Is the use of commercial VPNs allowed in your organization's security policy? If not, this could indicate a violation. Hidden Activity: Is the non-standard port usage an attempt to mask other activities happening over the VPN tunnel?
Total count of VPN connections using potentially unusual connection configurations such as static TLS key auth.

content.query:
corelight_vpn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where Inferences has_any ("TLS", "SK")
| summarize count() by src_ip, dest_ip
| count

content.json:
#### Unmonitored commercial VPNs with a typical traffic patterns or static keys could be used to bypass security controls for data theft.

#### **Investigate:** Examine VPN sessions with large outgoing transfers, focusing on unusual destinations or protocols.
Total count of VPN connections that are using the RW- Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) and FW - Firewall subversion inferences.

content.query:
corelight_vpn
| where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
| where Inferences has_any ("RW", "FW")
| summarize count() by uid
| count

content.json: #### Monitoring for "RW" (Road Warrior) and "FW" (Firewall subversion) inferences is crucial for detecting potential unauthorized access, as these patterns may indicate attempts to bypass security controls. Security teams should prioritize correlating these inferences with internal IP ranges and device logs to identify suspicious activities.

content.query:
let FilteredVPN = (
    corelight_vpn
    | where ('*' in ({Sensor}) or sensor_name in ({Sensor}))
    | where Inferences has_any ("RW", "FW")
    );
let VPNCount = ( 
    FilteredVPN
    | summarize Count = count() by uid
    );
let QueryResults = (
FilteredVPN
| join kind=leftouter(VPNCount) on uid
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by uid
| extend
    Source = src_ip,
    Responder = dest_ip,
    Proto = proto,
    Inferences = Inferences,
    Bytes = orig_bytes
| extend NewInferences = strcat_array(todynamic(Inferences), ",")
| project
    Source,
    Responder,
    Proto,
    Inferences = NewInferences,
    ["Dest Port"] = dest_port,
    Bytes,
    Count
| sort by Count
);
let QueryCount = (
VPNCount
| count 
);
let NoResults = (
datatable ( Source: string, Responder: string, Proto: string, Inferences: string, ["Dest Port"]: string, Bytes: string , Count: long)
["No Results", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", "N/A", 0]
);
union isfuzzy=true 
(QueryResults | where toscalar(QueryCount) != 0),
(NoResults | where toscalar(QueryCount) == 0)
| extend ["Dest Port"] = coalesce(tostring(tolong(['Dest Port_real'])), ['Dest Port_string']), Bytes = coalesce(tostring(tolong(Bytes_real)), Bytes_string)
| project-away ['Dest Port_*'], Bytes_*
| project-reorder 
    Source,
    Responder,
    Proto,
    Inferences,
    ["Dest Port"],
    Bytes,
    Count
